Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles currently hold a commanding 4-0 lead in the season series against the White Sox, showcasing their dominance thus far.
The White Sox have struggled on the road, posting an abysmal 0-10 record in their last ten games, and are currently on a 10-game losing streak.
The Orioles, while not at their best lately with a 5-5 record and a.198 batting average, still hold a significant advantage in this matchup.
Eloy Jimenez has been a critical player for the White Sox this season, despite the team's overall struggles.
The Orioles will be starting Corbin Burnes, who has a solid ERA of 3.23 and a WHIP of 1.13.
The White Sox's batting against right-handed pitchers has been lackluster, but Jimenez could be the exception, especially if he finds his groove early in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This matchup will be crucial for Corbin Burnes, as he needs to contain the White Sox's offense while the Orioles' bats look to produce runs.
The Orioles boast a stronger bullpen, which has been effective in closing out games.
The White Sox need to find a way to generate runs to support their struggling pitchers.
The Orioles have a more balanced approach, with solid hitting and pitching.
Others: The game will begin at 3:05 p.m. EDT in Baltimore.
The Orioles currently hold a sixth-ranked team ERA of 3.94 in the American League.
The White Sox have a team ERA of 4.84, which ranks them at the bottom of the league.
